channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-927] IllegalStateException: Unknown protocol: fab trying to install Examples
item.description:
I built all of the examples, and then tried to install the cbr example using "osgi:install -s fab:mvn:org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse/cbr/2.7.0.redhat-610112"

This gave me:

JBossFuse:karaf@root> osgi:install -s fab:mvn:org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse/cbr/2.7.0.redhat-610112
Bundle IDs:
Error executing command: Error installing bundles:
Unable to install bundle fab:mvn:org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse/cbr/2.7.0.redhat-610112
JBossFuse:karaf@root> log:display

The log contained:

2013-10-09 11:03:01,580 | INFO | l Console Thread | Console | ? ? | 17 - org.apache.karaf.shell.console - 2.3.0.redhat-610112 | Exception caught while executing command
org.apache.karaf.shell.console.MultiException: Error installing bundles:
Unable to install bundle fab:mvn:org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse/cbr/2.7.0.redhat-610112

... 11 more

item.summary: IllegalStateException: Unknown protocol: fab trying to install Examples

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: UPDATE: The problem here is that I had done a fabric:create first. We need to update READMEs to explain this or give alternative install commands

I think you get this if you have created a fabric before attempting to run demos, as you container is now managed by fabric.

Can we update the readmes with details of how to run demos in this case? It's likely to confuse new users.
